It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks, where it thrives in partial to full shade. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to white, adding a subtle contrast to its vibrant leaves. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Cirrhaea viridipurpurea is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological health in its native regions.
